any topic that had no direct bearingon himself. He could remain silent for hours without being at all put out of countenance himself or making others uncomfortable, but as soon as the conversa- tion concerned himself he would begin to talk circumstantially and with evident satisfaction. 
"Consider my position, Peter Nikoldevich. Were I in the cavalry I should get not more than two hundred rubles every four months, even with the rank of lieutenant; but as it is I receive two hundred and thirty
